alert.note: Alert for Lee (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 08 at 10:18AM EDT until May 08 at 4:38PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Heidelberg affecting Lee County. For the Kentucky River...including Whitesburg, Hazard, Jackson, Oneida, Booneville, Heidelberg, Ravenna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Heidelberg. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Low lying areas flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 20.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EDT Sunday was 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 11.9 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.1 feet on 03/24/1934. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by this evening.
